Chan and concentration are Sanskrit terms.
This is called the forest of the aggregate of merit.
The Buddhas of the three realms all speak of sitting in Chan.
Therefore, it is called the forest of the aggregate of merit. Another question:
What is called the Dharma of Chan? Answer:
The methods of meditation have a sequence from the general.
When first learning, there are seven kinds of contemplation methods from beginning to end.
The first is the method of abiding in the mind.
The second is the method of the empty mind.
The third is the method of non-existence.
The fourth is the method of liberation of the mind.
The fifth is the method of dhyÄna concentration.
The sixth is the method of true and wondrous.
The seventh is the method of wisdom.
As for the method of abiding in the mind,
it means the mind is scattered and agitated, clinging and not abiding.
Concentrating the mind and abiding, without going or moving,
therefore it is called the method of abiding in the mind.
As for the method of the empty mind,
it means observing the mind turning and realizing the mind is empty and tranquil.
Without going or coming, without a place to abide,
without a mind to rely on,
therefore it is called the method of the empty mind.
The method of the formless mind.
It means the mind is clear and pure, without any appearance.
Not blue, not yellow, not red, not white.
Not long, not short, not large, not small.
Not square, not round, tranquil and unmoving.
Therefore it is called the method of the formless.
The mind liberation gate means
knowing the mind is unattached and unfettered.
All afflictions do not arise in the mind.
Therefore it is called the mind liberation gate.
DhyÄna concentration means
the Sanskrit sound in the Western Regions.
The Tang Dynasty calls it tranquil contemplation.
The enlightened mind is tranquil.
When walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, it is all tranquil without any distraction.
Therefore it is called tranquil.
The suchness gate means
the enlightened mind is mindless and equal to empty space.
It pervades the Dharma realm equally without duality.
It is unchanging.
Therefore it is called the suchness gate.
The wisdom gate means
cognizing and understanding everything is called wisdom.
Penetrating and reaching the source of emptiness is called discernment.
Therefore it is called the wisdom gate.
It is also called the ultimate path.

This is because one cultivates dhyÄna and studies the Way.
